Text:
...And that is that. All today's paperwork has been
settled.

Lady Elisabeth! We have trouble! Monsters have
appeared nearby!
...I shall see to them at once.
Hah!
Gyaaargh!!!
That ought to be the last of them.

I've cleared this area as well. Masterfully done,
my lady.

Nothing like a bit of exercise to help
my breakfast settle.

Still, it would seem plenty of monsters remain within
our lands.

We're close to the border here... Small as our
nation is, our neighbors don't see the need to post
any guards.

It's fortunate that I happened to be nearby this
time...but it seems we need to bolster our security.
Sadly, we lack the funds to do so...

I'm well aware of that. I have a plan to offer
bounties, perhaps to those looking to test their
mettle.

Earning both experience and coin at the same time
would be a windfall for anyone who takes the offer,
as well.

However...I don't like how it feels as if we'd be
haggling for cheap labor...

We'd be doing nothing of the sort. There are those
out there who enjoy hunting monsters.

Truth be told, I'm a bit interested myself. Maybe one
day I'll heed the call of the hunt as well...

Heehee, please don't. I couldn't bear to part ways
with my dearest right hand.
Why, Lady Elisabeth, I... Thank you.

M'lady! A thousand blessings upon you for
slaying those creatures!
Hm? Ah yes, of course. Are you unharmed?
Have no fears, m'lady! I saw it all safe from　hiding!

You sliced those monsters in two with a single
stroke!
Yes, I suppose it was quite the spectacle...

M'lady, we would love to share our table with you as
thanks for saving the village! Please, join us!

Well... I did just have breakfast...but I cannot
refuse such generosity.
I humbly accept your gracious offer.

I'm sure it pales in comparison to what you normally
dine on, but we've prepared the finest meal we could!
Well, let's give it a taste, shall we?
Mm, this is very good. You must try some, my lady.

...How interesting. The acidity of this fruit
accentuates the flavor. It's very delicious.

I'm so happy that it's to your liking... That tart
bite is the happy accident of an otherwise poor
harvest this year.

Is that so? But...it's true that the sun has been
relentlessly strong lately.

Hasn't been much rain, neither, so it looks as if
we're in for a drought.

I see... But unfortunately, weather manipulation is
beyond my abilities.
...What is it, Mary? Did you have something in mind?

N-No, no! I was merely surprised to hear that there
are some things even you can't do...
You think much too highly of me.

Still...this is a fresh reminder of the many
hardships my subjects face.

My own lifestyle is too opulent. Perhaps I should
consider lowering taxes this year...
Um, are you certain, my lady?!

I am. Lining my own coin purse has never been my
intent.

The castle has supplies stockpiled for times such as
these. If you ever need assistance, please don't
hesitate to ask.

Such generosity... You are too kind, m'lady. We are
truly blessed to call such a wonderful land home.

A wonderful land... And yet I can only offer aid to
those in my realm. This is the least I can do for
them.

We hear talk of other lands where people are kept
like livestock, existing solely to provide blood to
their vampire masters. Compared to that, this is the
picture of peace...

I...sincerely hope those are only rumors. Although,
I can think of several of my kin who are capable of
such things.
Lady Elisabeth, we must think of the time.

Oh my, is it already that late? Are there no
exceptions, especially since we're out and about?

I'm afraid not. Deviate from the plan once, and all
the rest comes apart. Let us return to the castle.

*sigh*... Very well. You must forgive us. We accepted
your kind invitation only to have rush out.

Not at all, m'lady! It was an honor to have you as my
guest, even for just a moment!

Good...then I shall take my leave. Thank you for the
delicious meal.
...There are still so many documents left.

And compared to this morning, it seems that most of
them are difficult...

I set aside the easier ones that only require a seal
for the morning, to help you wake up.

So you've been thinking of me without me even
noticing it. You never cease to impress, Mary.
On that note, I will go draw your bath.

S-Say, you could at least stay and help with this
mountain of documents—
My duty is to tend to you, my lady.

Quite the stickler, aren't we... But that, too, is
proof of your ability.

...Oh well, I suppose I should take care of these
papers before my bath is ready.
Elisabeth continues her paperwork in silence.
